question.title: Java error when Syncing after Android Studio update from Koala to Narwhal
question.body:
My Cordova Android apps** built and ran fine under Android Studio Koala. I then updated to Narwhal (2025.1.1).

Given the deprecation of jcenter(), I followed advice in post "JCenter deprecation; impact on Gradle and Android" and added mavenCentral as a repository. So far so good.

Studio then complained that the minimum supported Gradle was 8.9. So I updated Gradle to 9.0-milestone-1 and AGP to 8.11.1

BUT: A Sync then immediately gives:

java.lang.IllegalStateException: No match found with no further indication of where.

Upgrading SDK to 36 has not effect. I could upgrade Cordova from 7.1.1 to 14.0.1, but I donâ€™t yet want to dig a deeper hole than I am in already!)

Any suggestions of where to look further (error log ??) to fix the IllegalStateException (above) appreciated

** SdkVersion 34; Gradle 7.5; AGP 7.4; Cordova 7.1.1

question_comments.body: Ouch, that sounds like someone at either Google or JetBrains made a mistake in how they evaluate latest versions :(.
... I was seduced by the recommendation from Android Studio itself ("We recommend upgrading to Gradle version 9.0-milestone-1") !
Quite right Mark - thank you. Regressing to 8.14.3 with AGP 8.11.1 cleared the problem.
Don't upgrade to development milestones. Gradle 9.0-milestone-1 is not a released version. Use a released version (current latest is 8.14.3).
